intro: Meionectes preissii, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, glandular leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds dispersed by animals. Meionectes preissii is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
